reviews.text: Had an excellent experience at Zaytinya by Jose Andres. The food was very tasteful and unique. The cocktails were delicious and so was the wine. The menu was expansive so our large group decided on a tasting menu and it was awesome. The tasting menu was vast for the price, we got to try a little big of everything and it all tasted great. Service was slow at the beginning but after we got our first round of drinks the attention to detail picked up. I would normally comment on the dishes I really enjoy but I tried so many things it would be hard to choose. Definitely a spot to check out for some Mediterranean cuisine and I highly recommend it.

Wow! 🎶
Everything was fantastic. I can’t remember the last time I enjoyed such a wonderful meal.
We had a reservation for an afternoon lunch. Upon arrival, we were greeted and seated immediately.  The wait staff was courteous and efficient.  We let our daughter, Julia, order for our table; everything she suggested was delicious and cooked to perfection. The pacing of the dishes was nice as well; a few dishes were brought out at a time.  We weren’t rushed and plates were cleared away between courses. We were there just over an hour and even had dessert.
I can’t wait to go again. ✨

I get the hype! The chef’s tasting menu ($70 PP) was delish and very filling. The appetizers were all top notch. The hummus was especially smooth (I don’t think I’ve had any hummus has smooth as this before). The beef strips resembled cured meat and was also delicious when paired with the grapes and pine nuts. Feta salad with mandarin slices and beets was also very good. We requested for the octopus to be included and it was hands down the best cooked octopus I’ve eaten. It’s not rubbery at all and has a perfect char on it. Of all the things we got, the only dish I would not eat again are the zucchini Patties. They had an odd flavor to them that reminded me of how ammonia or sulfur smells.

The two desserts were a molten coffee cake and apricot green yogurt. The top of the apricot dessert was extremely tart but you can take off the sorbet if you don’t like tart items. The lava cake was slightly molten in the center but had excellent flavor — slightly bitter, deep coffee depth, but not too sweet.

Had an amazing time at Zaytinya. The service was great, the food was amazing and the ambiance was very intimate. Came here for an anniversary and it was top of the line. From service, to food and ambiance. Highly recommend to everyone. We tried the chef tasting and it was incredible. An abundance of food. I was super full at the end. A great way to try mostly everything on the menu if you are not sure what to order.  Also I was not a big fan of lamb. But the way the lamb shank was made, definitely made me rethink all of that. It was so delicious and there was no aftertaste to it. Super delicious, tasted just like a steak!

5 stars across the board. This is hands down some of the best Mediterranean food I’ve had in the area. I came here for DC restaurant week and was blown away. The decor, food, and service were all phenomenal. I usually don’t particularly love dining during restaurant week because it’s generally not a great value, the portions are small and the quality standard usually is lesser. However, that was not the case here. The restaurant week menu was a great value and had sufficient portions. We ordered a few additional small plates, out of curiosity but it wasn’t a necessity. The food was all very tasty, as well as the cocktail on special. Service was great from the hostesses to the server and bussers. Everyone was very pleasant and professional. I definitely intend on coming back.

DELICIOUS!! Glad I tried this place out. Must say, this is pretty good chicken that tastes freshly made. Mobile ordering at the table is available, or you could order at the counter. Menu has many options for you to pick from, from bowls to chicken breasts, even, sandwiches! Staff were friendly and accommodating. Just wish they had a bigger dessert menu. But, overall, I still plan to return. Must try!!

I have been wanting to try Nando’s for a very very long time. Finally!

We ordered the whole chicken and the wings. We also tried the custard tarts for dessert. I am not really a fan of the custard. They are ordinary for me. But the chicken and the sauces… those are a different story.

I can understand the craze and hype about Nando’s and how they franchised so quickly. I cannot even find the right words to describe it. The chicken is halal, I believe, which is why it’s also a hit for our Muslim brothers. The chicken is very tender and has the right amount of flavor that will complement any sauce you choose. From mild to extremely hot, you can dip or drown the chicken in any sauces and finish it to the bones.

Ordering and paying is through their website or app. Make sure you put your table number if you are dining in and they will serve your order in 10-20 minutes. You do not need to buzz your table after eating. The staff will do that for you. Hence, you need to tip. You have to get your own sauces, utensils, and fountain drink/water though.

I have tried their juice as well. I think I ordered something with a pineapple orange and it is very refreshing. Sweet but refreshing.

Credit cards accepted. For this location, and most establishments nearby (that I have noticed), there is security present.

Portuguese is on of my favorite cuisines, I was so happy to be in Washington D.C. and see a great chain of a Portuguese restaurant every where in D.C.
we ordered chicken, dessert and garlic bread. The chicken and the garlic bread were SO delicious. I hope they can open in NJ or in NY. Also the place was pleasant and they have a big area of different seating.

The chicken was so delicious with a variety of spice options; we chose lime and hot options. They have much indoor seating. For drinks option they have Portuguese beer and wine! As well as other non alcoholic beverages. They have pasteis de Nata. The staff is friendly. Also they are very clean and keep covid precaution practices. After each person leaves, I noticed they cleaned the table right away. They also have contactless food ordering by scanning the barcode and ordering online with payment. I really loved coming here and hope to return again in the future.

First time for Persian chicken and will definitely be back! The chicken bowl was delicious. The plentiful options for sauces made the experience so much fun. Love that they bring the food to you vs standing at counter waiting for your order. The only thing I would change is to have wait staff come to your table vs standing in line to order.

Absolutely amazing spot!!!! The service was incredible. The good was amazing!!! Catfish entree with Jalapeño grits and collards......A MUST! Sweet potato pancakes......A MUST! The lattes are pretty tasty. The ambience and music were really cool. The most shoebox thing is being able to read and so for books in the same space. I can't wait to come back.

As soon as you step foot inside the restaurant you are captured by the design and layout. The books that they have out for display are very interesting. Then, you have the food. I only had the shrimp and grits, but the other meals caught my attention so much that I need to go back.

My group is visiting from Ohio for a conference. The restaurant is pleasingly eclectic in its decor. The atmosphere was quaint. The server was pleasant and smile with authenticity as she assisted the three of us. The food was served hot and was pleasing plated. The taste of the good was amazing. The seasoning of the catfish, greens and cheddar and jalapeño grits was perfect. I could eat here every day.

I love the idea of this place!! They sell books! It's amazing!! The artwork is powerful and speaks volumes without spoken words. I came here with a group for my scholarship and we got a whole from to ourselves. It's a very big place with multiple rooms and a huge outdoor patio. Service was great and everyone was friendly and helpful. The ART tho 😍🤩🙌

I absolutely loved it here! I loved how the staff were just having a good time and jamming out to music while working. The girl behind the bar was living her best life with the music. The whole place has a fantastic vibe and great food. We came for brunch but I'm sure dinner is just as great!

Great craft beer bar, knowledgeable bar staff, 50 beers on tap, wish they had less national/big craft beers on tap and more local.  Extensive beer bottle list with hard to find beers, especially good Belgium beer selection.  Fast friendly service, hard to notice from the street.  Definitely recommend a visit if you love beer.

Do you like good craft beer? Well if you’re in DC’s Logan Circle neighborhood you definitely need to check this place out. It has a massive beer selection with something for every taste. From awesome DIPA and everything in between. Also we had the tater tots and the cauliflower bites… and they were incredibly delicious. Also, a super cool vibe inside with plenty of seating. A must see if you enjoy great beer.

Top notch selection of craft beers in DC. Also one of the most extensive whiskey/ bourbon catalogs around. Atmosphere is good, and the food comes through.  The homemade tots are a must have. Great location on 14th st close to Logan circle. Stop and have a beer or two.

Walking up to the chalkboard signage propped directly infront of this black and brick fortress, I was prepared to be greeted by your run of the mill, New-American watering hole. What I came to find once I walked up those hallowed steps was a dimly lit leather sanctuary that would quickly become one of my favorite beer and bourbon bars I've ever had the pleasure of visiting.

The ambiance alone is enough to keep you coming back - you can tell they put a lot of effort into finding just the right lighting with just the right accents to fine tune your brain for booze consumption. Let me stop dancing around the main point here - ChurchKey's beer list rivals the best I've ever seen. This may sound hyperbolic, and maybe it is, but having been exposed to world class beer bars across the States I feel my barometer is calibrated to appreciate what this place is trying to accomplish. Anytime you have fresh IPAs from Fidens/Monkish/Other Half in the same vicinity as Side Project white labels and rare Cantillon lambics, you know you've fallen into a honey hole.

The bourbon list, though not as extensive as their beer offerings, is perfectly curated with many top tier choices. Anywhere from a Weller Antique 107 to a Michter's 20 - they truly have an incredible lineup of brown water.

I can't really comment on the food as my trip was all business (alcohol only), but from what I could tell they're no slouches on the grub they serve up here.

If you are a lover of beer or bourbon or even just want a nice pint of your go-to sauce, you need to go to Church.
Insane craft beer menu! This place is the bomb - incredible menu of beers on tap and in the fridge. Awesome ambiance. We’ll just have to keep coming back to get through the menu 🍻

Superb food and an experience to remember from the moment we entered the restaurant. It was a birthday celebration and there were so many unique experiences. The beer menu is extensive. I had a cherry beer which was sweet but not too sweet. For appetizer, I had the beet salad. The beets melted in your mouth. I had the duck for the main course and it tasted like filet mignon with a crisp fatty edge. The wait staff was the best. We loved Amber.
Such a great meal!  The duck was so delicious. We also had amazing oysters. The most exciting was the huge selection of Belgium beer. So fun to try so many!

Great place for Belgian beer and mussels and frites. There are four types of mussels on the menu and the frites come with three different Mayo based dipping sauces.

They also sometimes have happy hours specific to certain beer companies. And they know a lot about beer. Nice that it's open now since it was closed for the pandemic. They have a really large patio without outdoor seating.

Sit at their outside patio or inside, Brasserie Beck has been a staple for mussels and Belgian cuisine for years. The beer list reads like a short novel and shouldn’t be missed. We ate here recently for the first time in years and the food (mussels, burger and frites, and chilled beers) was all solid, though perhaps a bit below its pre-pandemic levels. Service was exceptional.

The place is large and spacious, the kitchen is in the middle and visible , the atmosphere is very nice and relaxed . Food taste great and portions are really generous.
A beer menu that looks endless and full of great choices .
We’ve been here on two different evenings.
Onion soup, charcuterie, burgers, moules au vin blanc, truffled ham sandwich everything was delicious nicely presented and worth it.
The owner and the staff always prompt kind and professional are the cherry on top of this business.

Nice restaurant in D.C.. The cocktails and the calamari was a really good way to start. I had the shrimp scampi and it was delicious. The pasta was perfectly cooked and definitely a must try. My friends enjoyed their entrées as well. I love the feel of the restaurant. Nice lighting and interior with a nice bar as well. The service was nice and efficient. Highly recommend this place.

Clyde's was on point as usual. I got there around 11:30 on a Sunday morning and by the time I left an hour later the restaurant was packed (the bar had the World Cup final on TV). Great food and an awesome cocktail made my lunch amazing. I got a grilled chicken sandwich and the A-Pear-ently It's Fall drink. Jasmine, my server, also brought a small wedge of warm crumb cake. Delicious!! First floor has a bar and dining area, but the second floor is where everything happens. Another bar, tons of booths and tables, and there's even an indoor patio area. Jasmine was the best, she took very good care of me and made sure I had everything I needed. Check out Clyde's for a casual, laid back dining experience.

I have come to Clyde's every time I come to DC and decided to have my birthday brunch here today.  It didn't disappoint. The service staff was attentive and polite.  I opened with mussels and had the lump crab cake as an entree.  Both were gorgeous and delicious. I finished with a blackberry shortcake.  Highly recommended.

We went around 11pm on a Thursday. It was crowded. We went too late to be seated by a hostess but we were allowed to sit at a booth in the bar area. We ordered food from the late night menu. The crab and artichoke dip was just right. It wasn’t oily. The chili was delicious with the sour cream and cheese. The crab Cake was tasty. We would go back again.

We were from out of town and decided to catch a hockey game. Unfortunately it didn't occur to us that finding a place to eat before the game would be so hard. We walked into Clydes and it was mobbed. At least an hour wait and we had 2 young children. However the manager on duty saw our struggle and managed to seat us right away. Amazing customer service and I'd give 5 stars just for that!

Food was delicious and service was top notch. Go here.

Overall I thought it was good. Had the pot pie, French onion soup, and the Mac and cheese. I say the food is good because if it were to have a touch of garlic powder, a hint of rosemary, or some fresh cracked pepper, it would shift to great. It was by no stretch of the imagination bad, it was good with small room for improvement. I’ll still be back.

The service was great. The waitress was very attentive. The manager came to the table and asked how things were. To me that is perfection. It shows they are committed to the customer experience. I really appreciated that.

The dress code was casual. It was nice to see people just there relaxing and having a good time.

I will certainly be back.

We arrived at opening and were only customers until closer to noon. The staff are the best. One at our party even reached out about a job opportunity to a waitress.

I ordered the duct confit croquettes. Very good and perfect size. Another ordered the Apple Parker House Rolls. I believe this may be the best bread I have ever eaten.

Others ordered French Onion and Kale Salad. She enjoyed both. Another had the Cuban. I went with Halibut Sandwich. The fish was cooked perfectly.

If in DC again I would go back.

This was my second time dining at Lincoln. I love the ambience and overall look of the restaurant. Service was attentive and courteous. I ordered the macaroni and cheese and French onion soup as starters and the pan roasted salmon as my entree. The macaroni and cheese is amazing, as it was the last time I was there. The French onion soup also delicious. I was a little disappointed in my salmon. I am a lover of salmon and order it as often as I can, but I found the salmon and accompanying brussels sprouts to be lacking seasoning. Overall, I would dine here again, and I look forward to my next time.
Such a great eatery spot, the food, service and atmosphere was amazing. I would have liked our mimosas to be stronger but it was tasty. The devil eggs and fried green tomatoes were my absolute fave.

I was pleasantly surprised by this outstanding dining experience. So happy to have found this gem.  The food and menu surpassed our expectations.  We had to come back later for to go desserts.  The restaurant decor is so interesting, amazing artwork, and fascinating murals of pennies.  The staff was great.  I highly recommend a visit and I look forward to my return.

name: Cuba Libre Restaurant & Rum Bar - Washington, D.C.

html_attributions: Cuba Libre Restaurant & Rum Bar - Washington, D.C.

reviews.text:
Husband and I love coming here for lunch/brunch on Sundays!

If you like high end shopping, there is a shopping center right by this place.

The interior is really well done, you feel like you're walked into a Universal Resort or theme park Cuban/Hispanic restaurant! I love seeing the interior whenever we eat here.

We've always walked here, so I can't comment about the parking. I also didn't use the bathroom, so I also can't comment.

Our waitress Paola was very patient with our children and loved interacting with them, thank you!

Our orders were put in quickly and everything was delicious.

The best food and the best drinks here at CUBA Libre. We had such a good time, and the food and drinks were DELICIOUS! Wait time is short and your food comes out fresh, made to order. You will love this spot in the heart of DC and just around the corner is shopping and cute little places you can visit to have some wine and dessert after your meal. You will love the food, drink & atmosphere here at CUBA Libre! Enjoy!

Fun Cuba feel to the place but Food was overpriced for the quality. Nice presentation on plate but taste not there. Burnt bread and reheated beans as a $23 plate. Server was not competent but luckily the great hostess jumped in to assist. I would be willing to try again if improvements made, potential for good food is possible. Unfortunately my 1st experience here was not good or for our group of 10 people

When in DC, this place is a must. We went on Valentines weekend so I think that’s why it was packed or is usually like that. The ambiance was fun. The food was delicious. It seemed a bit overpriced for me, specially the gaucho. The churrasco was delicious. The guacamole with plantain was my favorite dish. We had their rum and they were yummy. I’m not sure if they do this on purpose but the man’s drink were stronger than the women’s. We celebrated my friends birthday and they gave her a complementary flan. The waiter was nice but everyone seemed to be in a rush. The bathroom were clean and the huge mirrors made it so convenient to check yourself out.

I was so excited to go back to this place since my first experience few years back was wonderful and received excellent service. However, this time around was not the case. Our waiter didn’t even introduce himself to us and didn’t come by barley at all unless had to. Didn’t ask how our meals were and had to flag him for spoons for the soup. The Cuban sandwich was the worst I ever had. Didn’t even have 2 slices of the pork and overpowered by cheese. If I wanted a grilled ham and cheese sandwich I could of gone somewhere else. we were actually better off going to a Panera if you compare the service and food quality.  If I could get a refund for everything I would be happy that I didn’t have to waste all this money that wasn’t worth spending. The service was terrible and the food didn’t even justify our experience. Won’t return to this place and for others wanting to come. You can find better Cuban food someplace else. Seriously.

Steak was wayyyy over cooked and wine selection was minimal. It's just a hotel bar. If you don't feel like going to a real restaurant then this will do, just don't expect much. I definitely wouldn't choose to eat here ever again if I can help it.

I went for a paint nite event and was able to indulge in the menu and drinks.... I loved my meal the atmosphere was very nice as well.  The staff were amazing and talented . I definitely see myself returning for a full dining experience

Only used the restaurant for hotel breakfast, which was superb, and for take out wings and dessert, also superb!! Not a single complaint. Bar staff in particular were stellar - friendly and attentive.

Was in DC looking for a place to get a new and different salad.  Was not staying in this hotel, but found their salad with pomegranate seeds, candied walnuts, roasted squash, and goat cream cheese and decided to give it try.  It was a nice foray from all the burger joints in the area.  My server, Kelly, kept my tea glass full and made me feel very welcome by chatting for a few moments.  Overall, a really nice experience.

It's a restaurant attached to a decent hotel in a major city, so expect everything to cost a few dollars more than it is worth. That being said, the food is really good. In the several days I have stayed at the Embassy Suites I have had a burger, the turkey, and the chicken clubs. All were very well prepared and quite tasty. All of the staff I have dealt with are premium. Yes sir, no sir, quick to fill a drink, always stopping by to ask how you are doing. They are awesome.

I haven't had their breakfast bar yet, but my wife says it is really good, and strongly suggests getting the potatoes.

Worst place ever. The portions are the size of a side order but the price is that of a sitdown restaurant. Food is extremely greesy and oily. You will tatse a little bit of spice with oil in the whole dish and you end up eating that with whole lot of rice (see the pics) seriously save your money and go somehwere else. Not worth your money at all.

It used to be really good (about 3 yrs ago). Not sure why the quality and quantity started going down. However, it is one of the very few places where I would order a biryani from (In DC). Other places do NOT match up to the flavor that Red Toque offers. That being said, I sincerely hope they would go back to what they were doing back in 2016. It was really good!

I am glad that I did not read the reviews before I get there, because I really like it and definitely will order again. And the personal were really nice. By the way, for me the plates are good enough I order for me and my husband and we ate and still have food for lunch de next day 😁.
Thank you 🙏🏽

Delicious, authentic, hearty food! I can't get enough of the tabbouleh, chicken kabob and daal. This place is perfect for dining in with friends (or a date!) or for delivery. You don't even have to feel bad about it because the food is healthy and often vegetarian! I would definitely recommend it, especially to shake things up from usual American restaurants.

That's a lot of rice, throw a little lettuce in there to balance it out!
It's okay. Spices are okay not super impressed but it eats well. I'm used to getting a small 1/4 to 1/2 cup sized salad in these kinds of dishes but this one was all rice, some meat, some chickpeas. I get that you need to preserve profit in this covid life we're living but let's be reasonable here. I ordered kabob with rice not rice with kabob.

An amazing foodie experience. The personal experience from ALL the staff from the moment we walked in made for the start of an truly special anniversary dinning experience. Well worth the $$$. Jackets are not required for gentlemen, but I was also one of the very few without. The food was delicious and the photos don’t do them Justice. The neighboring tables were engaging and open for menu suggestions back and forth. And I think we saw a notable or too if your into the DC scene.

Phenomenal experience!
I celebrated my 5 year anniversary at Tosca, and they really made us feel special. The scallops, tenderloin, and veal were flavorful. Service was amazing, and we were seated in a beautiful area. I will definitely return!

This is an outstanding restaurant within the heart of Washington DC.
The venue was renovated during the pandemic, has a brand new interior with nice noise dampening ceiling panels which certainly keep the ambiance. Service is exceptional with knowledgeable waiting staff.
The food is Italian inspired modern dishes including refined selection of pastas, octopus with apple puree, perfectly prepared beef tenderloin, squid ink infused risotto with grilled calamari etc. Their wine list is dominated by an Italian selection complimented with Californian wines. From their deserts, the panna cotta is exceptional.
Not cheap, but for this experience, it is worth it.

10/10

Service is solid, the waiters are very attentive and want to make sure you're always content.

The dry-aged ribeye was delicious, the sauce was full of flavor. I wish it would have had more of the potato puree to add to the steak, but overall really enjoyed my dish.

Inside decor is very pretty.

Great location!

Tosca Is a lovely place for an upscale unfussy lunch downtown. Service is impeccable and food options are diverse and well prepared. Very easy to get in and out within an hour yet not fell rushed.  Go for the thoughtful appetiser menu, stay for the cocktails and delightful ambiance.

My first visit to this establishment was a party of two for a special Valentine's Day Menu. The maitre d' was kind and had a full smile, she promptly asked if they could take our coats followed by a swift pass to our waiter for seating. The ambience is nice, an open dining room concept allowing you to view most of the dining room. The lights are dimmed and give a candlelight style vibe which was nice. Service for the table was spot on, the waiter was amazing, giving great wine recommendations and proper service the entire night. I started with the bang bang shrimp appetizer which was honestly, the best I've had (definitely better than Bonefish). The flavor was rich and texture was a bit more creamy with a larger shrimp size than most places serving the same app. The main course of Pan Seared Chilean Sea Bass was cooked well, the firm texture of the fish went well with the sundried tomato risotto. The mac and cheese was lackluster, it had a great velvety cheese texture but lacked the sharpness I think defines a "good" mac. The cheeses chosen were too mild in my opinion. The creamed spinach was good. The Lemon Crunch Cake dessert was darn tasty, not too acidic or lemony but well balanced, not a great deal of crunch but the flavors coming from the dish outshine the need for "crunch". Great overall experience, I would recommend going when it is not so crowded to truly enjoy your experience (some tables may be a bit close to other guest, but this is to be expected during a holiday/high volume day)

Our waiter was fantastic and the food was delicious and visually appealing. We had Caesar Salad, Chicken Noodle Soup, a Crab Cale Sandwich with fries and onion rings (fantastic!!!), Filet Mignon and Garlic Mashed Potatoes. Very satisfying meal.

Wonderful time at our company holiday party. Staff were fantastic. My only complaint was we had a seafood tower as a part of our preorder menu and it wasn't provided. The receipt was adjusted with no problem but I would have really loved to try it. Other food and appetizers were amazing.

The bang bang shrimp is bangin, as advertised. The bartenders are amazing and I can’t recommend this place enough. Everything they make they knock out of the park. I split an entree with my friend and the portions were fantastic. Not pictured: the delicious bread we got as an appetizer-appetizer.

I normally sit at the bar when I come, services on point and food is very tasty for what you're getting. I would highly recommend checking it out. Probably not the best steakhouse in Washington DC but for getting them out quickly and buying your meal this is one of my top picks. Price point is slightly higher than what they have posted on their menu on Google but not by much.

If I could give this place more stars, I would. The food was nothing short of excellent- top tier in every respect. It's pricey, but well worth it. The steak was a PERFECT medium rare all the way through. I've never seen one cooked that perfectly. The staff is also outstanding. They were very professional and fun too. I hope I'm not butchering the name spelling,  but Giovanni and Miner (if I heard that right- my hearing isn't great) were awesome.

I would recommend to anyone.

I was a member of a party of 5 for my friend's birthday. We were able to reserve a table in advance which was very convenient. Our server, José, was impeccably warm and attentive. The food was beautifully plated and delicious. I tried the chicken-fried lobster and would totally recommend. No part of our meal or experience was anything less than great. It's pricey, but I'd definitely dine here again.

Went here for dinner to celebrate my birthday with friends. They were really great at accomplishing a large group of 11. Service was a little bit slow, but that is okay since there was so many of us. Everyone really enjoyed their food and drinks. I ordered the king crab and creamed corn, both were very delicious. The sangrias were also a hit if you like sweet drinks. Just be aware that cake cutting is $5 PER SLICE. yikes. At least they gave me the slice with my name on it.

I visited Oceanaire this past week and had an awesome experience.  Firstly the waitstaff who seated us were polite and attentive. Seating was nice and the section was dimly lit which gave a comfy feel. Our
waiter Sam was awesome. He was personable and knowledgeable of the menu and wine list! He was professional yet very easy to talk to and his suggestions were spot on.  For my main course I ordered the double lobster tail and it was delish! Overall my experience was A1 and I would recommend Oceanaire to friends and family.

I wish I could give 4.5 stars. I love the Oceanaire! But this was not our best experience at one. Not bad at all but definitely, it was "pre valentine's day" mode and it was palpable in the service. Food - delicious, fresh, bright. So good! We had the crab soup (amazing), oreganata scallops (a bit too creamy), house cobb salad (basic, nothing special, but big portion), tuna tartar (my fave), calamari (big portion and delicious!!), and a raw oyster. Drinks are delicious too. Service - we had 3 or 4 waiters (I think most of them were being trained in preparation for vday weekend, which was the next day); nothing wrong with them but we felt like we were interupted every five minutes by each one checking on us. One waiter is enough, but too many meant too many checkins. I would definitely return for the food and ambience on a fancy night out, but I think I'll be more careful about the day and holidays I choose to eat around.

I have been going to park for near 5 years and I never quite liked it because I used to go when they were more of a club and I never thought I would really pick up and the vibes were a bit off.

However, in the last year it has become one of my favorite restaurants to visit in DC! I have gone a few times with my friend for fancy dinners where we dress up And their food is actually top tier here.  I've also attended some of their black professional networking events and paties which I enjoyed!

If you are looking for a LIT brunch experience this is it. The Park has a classy feel to it, but the experience is very day party like. Live DJ, bottle service, plated brunch and bottomless mimosas. Very energetic crowd, without being over the top rowdy. I actually really enjoyed the food also. The service is excellent- very quick and attentive. Honestly highly recommend if you are looking for a more upbeat, seated brunch experience! Brunch costs $80 per person, you need a reservation and you pay upfront upon entry at the door.

Had a wonderful experience! The waitress was on her game and very attentive. She kept the drinks coming and frequently checked to make sure we were good..the food was delicious and served hot. The ambience was a whole vibe. The music was lit and kept us vibing through our whole dining experience. We were visiting from out of state and made reservations in advance. I highly recommend this restaurant!!

Great time here. Music was good, the vibe and atmosphere was Great. I had a great server named Taylor. She was awesome by providing good customer service. She was on top of everything. I will definitely come back and I do recommend people coming here to get a great experience as well. I did like the little phases on the T.V. screens.

Had a blast here !! Food was really good for brunch … it’s like a big plate of food and unlimited mimosas … salmon was so good ! Wings came off the bone, delicious. You pay one fee and spend like 3 hours there. The music was pretty good too, after you drink a few glasses you might even get up and dance. Bathrooms upstairs are very tiny and a little outdated other then that service was very good and food was great would definitely recommend! We will be back!

This is a fantastic restaurant in the D.C. area. Myself and some friends had brunch reservations at 9:00 and had a fabulous time. The server was knowledgeable, professional, and funny, and our food was fantastic!

They also had fresh bread as a little appetizer from a local bakery included in the meal. There was hand churned butter to put on the bread as well.

The only negative thing that I have to say about this restaurant is the mosquitoes and flying insects. The windows were wide open, and with that, bugs flew around our food occasionally. It was extremely annoying. This is the only reason I’m giving this place four stars and not five.

Overall, my party enjoyed themselves, and the Quiche Florentine, salad, and fresh bread were excellent. Everyone enjoyed their meals, and the atmosphere was calm and fitting for the restaurant.

I’m not sure if I will be back or would recommend this place because of the open windows and flying bugs, but I did enjoy myself other than that.

Note: Don’t get the side of bacon - it isn’t worth the price.

Very cool restaurant, everything is very, very tasty, and looks great. We were satisfied with everything, I definitely recommend visiting this place in Washington.

Here I tried one of the tastiest onion soups I've ever had.  Escargots were also delicious, and garlic oil, in which they were baked, tasted very good with their home bread with nuts and cranberries. And the duck was also very tasty, order especially this dish. We ate it very quickly. The meat was well fried, the sauce went well, and the sweet plum complemented the taste. We also decided to try a dessert , and we selected profiteroles. Beautiful presentation, they were poured with chocolate, and it also tasted very well.

My Last meal in DC, Le Diplomate was a Perfect way to end an amazing trip. Star of the show was Millie our server!
Her attention to detail, and anticipation of our needs was impeccable. Highly suggest you request her for optimal dining experience.
The food came out at a beautiful pace and exploded with flavor and love. I highly recommend this place. Pace out your small plates share your entrees and enjoy the beautiful ambience! Merci. See you soon DC!

There are so many great brunch spots in DC, but this place tops them all. Better make that reservation since this place is always packed. From complementary bread basket to a variety of desserts, I never had any bad moments in this restaurant. My favorite dishes are egg Benedict, mushroom tart, escargot, and quiche. Service is also outstanding and everyone is so friendly. There aren’t a lot of parking spaces nearby though. I highly recommend this restaurant for brunch or celebrating any special days.

Amazing place! The food is so delicious, the wait time is short! I always eat different fish over there, those are always wonderful! The dessert presentations are so fancy! I tried onion soup as well, it was good! The waiters are so polite! Always crowded but very organized place! Love it!

The Sangria Hour is well worth it, as the cocktails and tapas are well priced. Tapas portions are large and shareable among friends that want to sample a few dishes. Classic flavours and quality you can count on. Dishes are not terribly creative, but the service is quick with minimalist communication.

My future wife and I went to Jaleo for restaurant week and also to meet with our potential wedding planner. I love the vibe of this restaurant and their staff. The sangria was awesome. My Fiancé enjoyed it. It was a 5 course meal with small tapas but at the end we were extremely full. Each persons meal was $40 during restaurant week. The bacon wrapped dates were awesome. We went to this restaurant 3 years ago so it was nostalgic. The dessert was probably my favorite pan chocolate. The waiter did a great job.

This place is so good.  I have been to the one in Chicago for happy hour and was excited to get a reservation here for dinner.  We did the $80/pp tasting experience and it was so worth it.  I don't eat pork and the chef was able to customize for me.  We had amazing service and the food was so delicious.  I loved the tasting because it allowed us to try so many things.

Fantastic experience overall with excellent service. Our bartender/server gave us great suggestions and the drinks were fantastic as well.

We were happy with every dish we received with one exception (our salad had mealy apple bits in it that detracted from the experience) and the octopus was cooked perfectly. Will happily return in the future.

During a recent trip to DC, I ate a few Michelin starred restaurants. However, it was the atmosphere and flavors of Jaleo that I can’t forget.
While the service was a little cold and mechanical, the drinks and menu well made up for it.
I ordered a plate from each of their categories and was shocked at the hefty portion sizes. This is not your average tapas plate size.
My absolute favorites were the Iberico, potato salad with roe, and the endive orange bites.

Definitely order a sherry cocktail from the bar!

My husband and I came here for our Valentine’s Day dinner and we were pleasantly surprised! The food here is so delicious! I can’t believe I never stopped in this restaurant before! The spinach dip was amazing! Like we were (shamefully) scraping the plate 😂😂🤦🏾‍♀️ The steaks, equally delicious and cooked perfectly! It was extremely busy, but our waiter remained attentive and served us pretty quickly considering how crazy it was. I’m definitely coming back to this restaurant for dinner again. Very, very good!

Fantastic place to eat brunch at. We got all appetizers and they were simply divine. The fried calamari came with some pickles which added to the flavor nicely. The shrimp cocktail and the crab dip were also superb. Also, the staff was super friendly! Would definitely come to eat here again if I visit DC again!

Went here for a birthday celebration. It served about 20 people at one time. Service was as good as it could be serving a number like this. The cornbread skillet was delicious. Everyone reaved about the lamb. I got the burger which was filling. I would return to try this place again.

Service was great send food was delicious.  I got there around 5pm for an early dinner.  The staff was marvelous, and extremely friendly.  The French Onion Soup had a bit of tang I wasn't used to but other than that everything was pretty standard fare

Very good steaks particularly the bone-in rib eye. Loved the corn bread. The cheesecake was a bit too sweet to my liking. The staff was professional and friendly. Definitely a place I'd come back to for dinner when in Washington.

Julia, Julia, Julia our bartender was awesome. She was very knowledge of all their options and willingly took the time to assist with choices desired and uncertain of. She explained, in detail, the differences between various items on the menu so that we coukd make the best choice for us overall. May I say that the wings were delicious and still burning the corners of my mouth, lol. The fries were heavy and truly filled you up after a few. The Creme Brule was an awesome choice in doughnut that I appreciate her advising me of it and last but not least that chedder biscuit blew me out of this world. I did not have enough space in me to ingest it all but at least I can rock twice tomorrow. Thankibg Julia for her service. It was awesome and appre oates. A must go while here in DC.

Not worth it. I’ve been dying to come to try the chicken and was sorely disappointed. Waited 40 minutes for bland chicken and a soggy sandwich. Donuts were fine, but not as good as my first try here. Staff was rude. We got there when it was empty, left when it was full. Might be short staffed but doesn’t mean you need to audibly sigh when someone needs to order from you.
Good beer selection but they don't have the complete Atro Donut menu. But great place.

First time here, a bit disappointed. The beer selection was definitely below average for a beer hall. Not crowded, it was easy to find a table to hang out. The 90's alternative rock music was enjoyable - not sure if this music is part of the theme or not. Overall, my experience was just okay.

The service is so bad here, I am stopping in the middle of my meal to write this, so that I might be able to spare another innocent and unknowing soul from coming in here and choking on a cheddar biscuit and their disappointment.
Staff are as pleasant as a bed of nails; food took 45 minutes (for 1 entree, 2 apps and 2 sides) and was mediocre at best.
The bartender and food expeditor were so dismal, another patron actually stopped to ask me, if they were in fact as miserable as he thought. I agreed emphatically and showed him I was in the middle of writing this review.
Spare yourself, your family/friends and tastebuds; but if you don’t like someone, send them here, cause they just might fit right in.

We held a wonderful surprise dinner last Friday.  The food was delicious and prepared nicely, compliments to the chef! The ambiance of the restaurant was perfect for our birthday celebration and the staff was phenomenal, especially Natasha!!! Everything was amazing!
Thanks to Corduroy for making Friday a special night.

We hosted a dinner in the private room upstairs with 17 guests for a wedding celebration and had a phenomenal experience. Our bartender took great care of us and was very accommodating. The service through dinner was terrific and the food was to die for.

We set up a pre fixe menu for our guests and selected some wines to serve during dinner. The process of selecting our menu in preparation was terrific. We also had some food allergies in our patty, and the staff was very helpful in navigating that.

We had a great experience and highly recommend the private rooms if you have a larger party!

Excellent tasting menu !

My family and I visited this establishment for my husband's birthday dinner. We had all different food restrictions (allergies, food preferences) and the chef accommodated all of our request for all of our tasting courses ! Foods were excellent. Service was out standing. Price was reasonable !

Can't wait to go back !

Definitely an interesting menu, however the tasting was enjoyable. Expect smaller portions and more light fare than dinner. The ambiance is what makes the restaurant, dark and moody, with an excellent wine selection. The hostess was also a great support to us throughout our tasting course. I may not return but I'm glad I got to experience it.

Came here for a company dinner. Accommodated me as a vegan 🌱, ended up having all courses available and they tasted amazing.

Colleagues all loved their food as well.

Server was great - really nice guy, had a few jokes and some banter as well.

Ella’s was so fun! Delicious penne pasta with pesto, sun dried tomatoes, and pine nuts (YUM). We also ordered the diablo pizza which was great. It wasn’t too spicy which I appreciated - just the right amount of kick. The pizza dough was amazing- the crust was crunchy on the outside, soft on the inside. The service was also really great - they got us seated quickly despite us not having a reservation, our server gave us great recommendations, and we got our check quickly. The vibe was great - tons of caps fans were there for the game and the bar had TVs with basketball on. Would absolutely recommend Ella’s for a casual but quality dinner!!

This is a nice place overall and I think the pizza was okay, but I also think that the pizza could have been better. To me, the cheese was not very tasteful, and there was not even very much cheese on the pizza. I had the margherita pizza. In my opinion, it was also overpriced. The craft beer selection could have been better. The cappuccino was pretty good. The staff were very friendly, and the decor and atmosphere were very nice. So overall, this was a nice place.

Six out of five!  :) Everything was perfection - fresh ingredients, perfectly seasoned appetizer and salmon salad; dessert almond cake was heavenly.
This was our first time here and we can't wait to come back!!

A very child friendly and family oriented restaurant.
The pizzas were delicious.
Atmosphere was great as the restaurant was nicely busy.
Staff were friendly and helpful.
Will definitely drop in again if we pass that way.

Excellent final lunch on our last day in DC (the 1st). Ella's was really quiet but staff were so welcoming & accommodating to us.

The American Wheel Pizza was a Chefs Kiss, just perfectly cooked, lovely taste as well 🍕.
